description: The marks of Suman in Hindi is 37 more than the two-third of her marks in English. If she scored \(x\) marks in English, then find her marks in Hindi.
solution:
Explanation:
Marks of Suman in English \(=x\)

\(\Rightarrow\) Two-third of \(x=\frac{2}{3} x\)

Hence, marks of Suman in Hindi \(=\frac{2}{3} x+37\)

description: Height of tree \(A\) is \(25 \mathrm{~m}\) less than two times the height of tree \(C\). What is the height of tree \(A\), if the height of tree \(C\) is \(x \mathrm{~m}\) ?
solution:
Explanation:
 Height of tree \(C=x \mathrm{~m}\)

Two times the height of tree \(C=2 x \mathrm{~m}\)

So, height of tree \(A=(2 x-25) \mathrm{m}\)

description: The perimeter of a square is \((8 a+10) \mathrm{cm}\). Find the area of the square, if the value of \(a\) is \(\frac{3}{4}\).
solution:
Explanation:
Perimeter of square \(=8 a+10\)

\(=8 \times \frac{3}{4}+10\)

\(=6+10=16 \mathrm{~cm}\)

\(\left(\because a=\frac{3}{4}\right)\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Side of square \(=\frac{16}{4}=4 \mathrm{~cm}\)

\(\Rightarrow\) Area of the square \(=4 \times 4=16\) sq. \(\mathrm{cm}\)

description: Ajay is \(26 \mathrm{~kg}\) heavier than his son. If the sum of their weights is \(50 \mathrm{~kg}\), then find the weight of Ajay.
solution:
Explanation:
Let the weight of the son be \(x \mathrm{~kg}\).

So, the weight of Ajay \(=(x+26) \mathrm{kg}\)

\(\therefore \quad\) The sum of their weights \(=(x+x+26) \mathrm{kg}\)

\(=(2 x+26) \mathrm{kg}\)

According to the question, we have

\(2 x+26=50\)

\(\Rightarrow 2 x+26-26=50-26\)

Subtracting 26 from both sides

\(\Rightarrow 2 x=24\)

\(\Rightarrow 2 x \div 2=24 \div 2 \quad\) (Dividing both sides by 2)

\(\Rightarrow x=12\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Weight of Ajay \(=12+26=38 \mathrm{~kg}\)

description: The cost of a purse is ₹ \(8 b\). A book costs twice as much as the purse. What is the total cost of 4 books and 3 purses?
solution:
Explanation:
 Cost of purse =₹ \(8 b\)

\(\Rightarrow\) Cost of 3 purses =₹\((3 \times 8 b)\)=₹ \( 24 b\)

\(\therefore\) Cost of book \(=2 \times\)₹ \(8 b\)=₹ \(16 b\)

\(\Rightarrow\) Cost of 4 books =₹\((4 \times 16 b)\)=₹ \( 64 b\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Total cost of 4 books and 3 purses =₹ 64 b + ₹24 b

= ₹ \(88 b\)

description: If three-fifth of two-seventh of a number is 198 , then find \(\left(\frac{1}{7}\right)^{\text {th }}\) of the same number.
solution:
Explanation:
Let the number be \(x\).

Three-fifth of two-seventh of \(x=\frac{3}{5} \times \frac{2}{7} \times x=\frac{6}{35} x\)

According to question, we have

\(\frac{6}{35} x=198\)

\(\Rightarrow x=\frac{198 \times 35}{6} \Rightarrow x=1155\)

Now, \(\left(\frac{1}{7}\right)^{\text {th }}\) of \(x=\frac{1}{7} \times 1155=165\)

description: One apple weighs 75 grams and one watermelon weighs \(1.40 \mathrm{~kg}\). Find the weight (in grams) of \(x\) apples and \(y\) watermelons.
solution:
Explanation:
 Weight of 1 apple \(=75 \mathrm{~g}\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Weight of \(x\) apples \(=75 \times x=(75 x) \mathrm{g}\)

Weight of 1 watermelon \(=1.40 \mathrm{~kg}=1400 \mathrm{~g}\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Weight of \(y\) watermelons \(=1400 \times y=(1400 y) \mathrm{g}\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Weight of \(x\) apples and \(y\) watermelons

\[
=(75 x+1400 y) \mathrm{g}=25(3 x+56 y) \mathrm{g}
\]

description: If \(a=8, b=12\) and \(c=3\), then find the value of \(\frac{16 b c-5 a b}{a b c-3 b}\).
solution:
Explanation:
 We have, \(\frac{16 b c-5 a b}{a b c-3 b}=\frac{16 \times 12 \times 3-5 \times 8 \times 12}{8 \times 12 \times 3-3 \times 12}\)

\(=\frac{576-480}{288-36}=\frac{96}{252}=\frac{8}{21}\)

description: I had 200 stamps with me. I gave \(x\) stamps to Anwar, \(\frac{x}{2}\) stamps to Vidhu and I am left with \(\frac{x}{2}\) stamps. How many stamps are given to Vidhu?
solution:
Explanation:
Total number of stamps \(=200\)

According to question, we have

\(\Rightarrow x+\frac{x}{2}+\frac{x}{2}=200 \Rightarrow \frac{2 x+x+x}{2}=200 \Rightarrow 4 x=400\)

\(\Rightarrow x=100\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Number of stamps given to Vidhu \(=\frac{100}{2}=50\)

description:
Find the solution of the equation:
\(
\frac{3 p-2}{3}+\frac{2 p+3}{2}=p+\frac{7}{6}
\)
solution:
Explanation:
 We have, \(\frac{3 p-2}{3}+\frac{2 p+3}{2}=p+\frac{7}{6}\)

\(\Rightarrow \frac{2(3 p-2)+2(2 p+3)}{6}=\frac{6 p+7}{6}\)

\(\Rightarrow 2(3 p-2)+3(2 p+3)=6 p+7\)

\(\Rightarrow 6 p-4+6 p+9=6 p+7\)

\(\Rightarrow 12 p+5=6 p+7 \Rightarrow 6 p=2\)

\(\Rightarrow p=\frac{2}{6}=\frac{1}{3}\)

description: Write the algebraic expression for the two digit number whose tens digit is ' \(y\) ' and units digit is ' \(x\) '.
solution:
Explanation:
 The digit at units place is \(x\).

And the digit at tens place is \(y\).

\(\therefore \quad\) The number can be expressed as

\(10 \times y+x=10 y+x\).

description: Sakshi has \(n\) apples. She gives 4 apples to her sister and packs the rest equally into 8 polybags. How many apples are there in each polybag?
solution:
Explanation:
Number of apples Sakshi has \(=n\)

Number of apples she gave to her sister \(=4\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Number of apples left with Sakshi \(=n-4\)

So, number of apples in each bag \(=(n-4) \div 8=\frac{n-4}{8}\)

description: Present age of Archana is 7 less than 7 times of \(z\). How old she was \(5 z\) years ago?
solution:
Explanation:
 Present age of Archana \(=(7 z-7)\) years

\(\therefore \quad\) Age of Archana, \(5 z\) years ago \(=(7 z-7-5 z)\) years \(=(2 z-7)\) years

description: Which of the following equations has \(x=8\) as the solution?
solution:
Explanation:
(A) We have, \(x+9=18\)

\(\Rightarrow x=18-9=9 \neq 8\)

(B) We have, \(\frac{x}{4}=3 \Rightarrow x=3 \times 4=12 \neq 8\)

(C) We have, \(15=x+7\)

\(\Rightarrow x=15-7=8\)

(D) \(x-15=8\)

\(\Rightarrow \quad x=8+15=23 \neq 8\)

description: Half of a number is added to \(18 y\), then the sum is 46. Find twice of the number.
solution:
Explanation:
 Let the number be \(x\).

According to question, we have

\(\frac{x}{2}+18 y=46 \Rightarrow \frac{x}{2}=46-18 y\)

\(\Rightarrow x=2 \times(46-18 y)=92-36 y\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Twice of the number \(=2(92-36 y)=184-72 y\)

description: A number \(y\) is always 13 less than twice of a number \(x\). Find \(y\), when \(x\) is 16 .
solution:
Explanation:
 We have, \(y=2 \times x-13\)

Putting \(x=16\), we get

\[
y=2 \times 16-13=32-13=19
\]

description: If length of a rectangular field is three more than the breadth \(m\) of the field, then find the perimeter of the field in terms of \(m\).
solution:
Explanation:
 Breadth of the rectangular field \(=m\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Length of the rectangular field \(=m+3\)

So, perimeter of the field \(=2(l+b)=2(m+3+m)\) \(=2(2 m+3)\)

description: The algebraic expression for the statement, "a number \(x\) is decreased by thrice the sum of \(5 x\) and 5 " is
solution:
Explanation:
Sum of \(5 x\) and \(5=5 x+5\)

So, thrice of \((5 x+5)=3(5 x+5)\)

\(\therefore \quad\) Required algebraic expression \(=x-3(5 x+5)\)
